column4: hmm if i was looking for a customized theme or style for my gnome what would i be looking to do, i want something pretty flash like you see in alot of youtube video's, what kinda projects are out that style gnome
im thinking more of customized window borders and such,
use emerald. That's what I've got and it works great, especially with a black border/theme and the standard orange ubuntu theme. Very flashy, very nice.
no prob. Just do a google of emerald and themes and the first link should be to a reliable site.
whats the name of your theme?
I'm using "83626-vision black" for my emerald theme.  I'd like to get it working for gnome too, but meh...
once ive imported it how does one activate it ?
um... go to System>Preferences>Emerald Theme Manager -- if it's not there, you might want to make sure it was installed.
i did that i had to import the .emerald file its there listed
hmmm, just click it and click okay. It will apply either immediately or on next reboot of X.
yeah even after a reboot, i have 2 emeral theme's importated but they wont activate
i think he has something to do with System - Pref - Appearance
bleh. I have no idea. I managed to click it, then click "quit" and it works for me -- yeah, try that. I really just bumbled my way through the setup.
just had to use the gkt version of slickness
